name: Dragon Half
description: The hybrid offspring of dragons and some other race. Usually fairly tall with
scaled skin (color varying), tails, horns, and slit eyes. Despite their
strength and genuinely calm nature, they are often ostracized by both sides of
their families. Excluded from the dragon race for not being pure-blooded
dragons and excluded from the human race for their appearance. Dragon halves
have an elemental affinity with fire as well as increased strength and spirit
making them formidable opponents or allies.

name: Dwarf
description: Dwarves are as rough as the mountains they make their homes in. Dwarves respect
traits such as courage and strength. They favor direct combat using melee
weapons and snub their noses especially hard at magic and ranged weapon users.
For this reason, they and the elves don't share a particular good relationship
with one another.

name: Dark Elf
description: Dark elves have a long history as dark wizards, ninjas, rogues as well as
fairly competent blade masters. Generally making their home in damp and marshy
places; and surprisingly they tend to be one of the more devout varieties of
elf taking great care to honor ancient ceremonies and traditions as well as
fiercely protecting sacred artifacts and holy sites.

name: Forest Elf
description: One of the few elven tribes to remain on their ancestral homelands the Forest
Elves are sometimes seen as sheltered or na√Øve by the other Elven tribes.
Forest elves also share a greater number of connections with races outside
their own due to a high demand for elven crafted goods.

name: High Elf
description: Seen as cowards and traitors by their own tribes and as arrogant and
off-putting by many of the other races. High Elves can usually be found in
positions of power or prestige. Their abilities with control magic combined
with their connections to nobility and royalty usually make them powerful
behind the scenes characters. However, High Elves are also gifted mages and can
certainly hold their own in battle just as well as the rest of their brethren.

name: Ice Elf
description: An ancient elven tribe which is said to have had strong ties to the Mu at one
point. Kept fairly isolated until recent times, the Ice Elves homeland has
recently become a spot of interest from outsiders due to the discovery of large
deposits of Mythril. Because of this Ice Elves can be a bit standoffish when
dealing with other races. However, once an Ice Elf's trust is earned their
skills with water and control magic make them powerful allies.

name: Human
description: While humans may not specialize in any one area. They are extremely flexible
and adaptive. Humans hold the most power of all races primarily due to their
speech. However, this isn't to say humans are completely helpless either and
have been involved with numerous skirmishes with most of the other races
particularly in the area of religious conflict. This is especially true among
the elves who have had much of their homeland seized by the humans in order to
obtain control of various Elven holy sites as well as access to natural
resources at those sites.

name: Mu
description: The Mu are an ancient race which has been hunted nearly to extinction after
being exiled from their homeland due to natural disaster. Mu are generally
anywhere from 6 - 7 feet tall and have a hunched appearance. Their snout tends
to be rounded and their floppy ears droop down on either side of their head.
Their eyes tend to be large and round, similar to those of a dog and their
entire body is covered with long shaggy hair except for their hands, feet,
face, and tail. Mu fur is extremely high quality and holds magic properties,
hence the poaching. The Mu tend to be especially acclimated to magic and some
myths even suggest the Mu alongside the Dragons created magic.

name: Vampire
description: Vampires can both be created and birthed and are an actual race. Rather than
being true undead. In Kite, vampires are merely creatures aligned with the
shadow element. Many other aspects of vampires such as being damaged by
sunlight hold true however. Vampires have naturally heightened speed as well as
a natural resistance to magic. To be transformed into a vampire; an entity must
both be bitten by the vampire as well as drink a small amount of that vampires
blood. Being transformed into a vampire replaces all racial abilities with the
vampire's. And the vampire's stat bonuses are immediately added to the
character's stats. However, to learn the Alyssian language, the entity will
still need to study that as a language skill.
